toolTips.perustiedot: Mandatory basic information about the project must be filled in. If all the mandatory information is not filled in, the new project will be saved in Haitaton but will not be able to proceed to the impact assessment. You can continue to fill in information on the project later by opening it via the project list
toolTips.nimi: Name that concisely describes the project
toolTips.onYKTHanke: Joint municipal worksite – a joint project under the cooperation agreement. In addition to the City of Helsinki’s Urban Environment Division, the parties are Helsinki City Transport (HKL), Helsinki Region Environmental Services (HSY), Helen Ltd, Helen Electricity Network Ltd, Auris Kaasunjakelu Ltd and the communications network operators Cinia Ltd, DNA Plc, Elisa Plc and Telia Finland Plc. The aim of the Shared Public Utility Site (YKT) partnership is to streamline the construction of public spaces in the city and adapt the contracting parties’ individual projects into jointly implemented projects that improve the quality and supply of infrastructure services.
toolTips.alkuPvm: Start date of project implementation (Note! Implementation in a public area, not, for example, on a plot)
toolTips.loppuPvm: End date of project implementation (Note! Implementation in a public area, not, for example, on the side of a plot)
toolTips.vaihe: A description of the progress of the project which will be updated as the project progresses. The programming phase is the initial project planning or pre-planning phase. In terms of the permit application process, the project is in the planning phase until it receives an execution permit from the city. At the construction phase, the project has received a permit from the city. Haitaton does not cover the permit application, construction or completion/maintenance/handover phases of the project.
toolTips.kuvaus: Description of the main content and objectives of the project. (Note! Implementation in a public area, not, for example, on the side of a plot)
toolTips.omistajat: The project owner is responsible for the entire project from its beginning to its end/completion/handover.
toolTips.arvioijat: The project analyst or assessor may be the project owner or another party authorised by the owner (for example, a project planning consultant or contractor not affiliated with the owner).
toolTips.toteuttajat: The person responsible for implementing the project may be the project owner or another party authorised by the owner (for example, a contractor not affiliated with the owner).
toolTips.tyomaaKatuosoite: The street address(es) of the project and the number or range of numbers (e.g. Mannerheimintie 5, Hämeentie 3–27) or other locating information if the street address is not available.
toolTips.tyomaaTyyppi: Multiple selection of project type. A project can consist of several different project types, which means you can select several project types.
toolTips.kaistaHaitta: Likely nuisance to lane arrangements on the main carriageways

perustiedotForm.instructions: <1>You can also send applications via the project creation.</1><1><0>PLEASE NOTE!</0> If you are only working on a cable report for a private area, <2>fill in the application</2>. Cable reports for public areas are applied for after the project has been created, via the excavation notification.</1><1>Please note that the following information will be publicly displayed to all Haitaton users after the project is published:</1><3><4>Project name, identifier and time period</4><4>Project description</4><4>Project area names and time periods</4><4>Project area traffic nuisance indexes</4><4>Project owner</4><4>Project phase and worksite type</4></3><1>When you have added the project information, you can copy it to the applications as required.</1>

hankkeenAlueForm.instructions: [TRANSLATION_PENDING]Several geometries can be drawn for the project. Geometry areas affect the project’s traffic congestion indices. Drawing tools can be found at the bottom left of the map view. With the pen tool, you can draw polygonal geometries by clicking the point where you want an angle. With the square tool, you can create square areas by first clicking the map and moving the mouse in the direction you want. Clicking it again “closes” the square drawing. A geometry can be edited by “grabbing” the edge of the geometry and dragging. A square geometry can also be shaped by grabbing the edge. lete a geometry, first select the geometry by clicking it; a bin icon will appear in the bottom left drawing tools which you can click to delete the geometry.
hankkeenAlueForm.instructions2: Transport mode selectors on the left side of the map allow you to view the inconvenience indices for project and work areas regarding particular transport modes. All transport modes are active by default. You can change visibility of the modes by clicking on the icons. The most critical index will be coloured in on the map.
hankkeenAlueForm.instructions3: You can edit an already drawn area by grabbing its edge and dragging the point to the desired location.
hankkeenAlueForm.noAlueet: Draw the area on the map to mark the hazard assessments.
hankkeenAlueForm.haitatInstructions: Give an estimate of the most significant impacts in the project area.

haittojenHallintaForm.instructions: Your project may hinder different modes of transport and local operations. Haitaton automatically calculates a significance value for each nuisance by project area separately for bicycle traffic, tram traffic, local bus traffic and car traffic. The traffic nuisance index describes the worst situation in the project area in terms of the aforementioned modes of transport. The disturbances are represented with a scale determined for each mode of transport and colours (0/grey = not identified, 1–2/green = no significant nuisance, 3/yellow = probable nuisance, 4–5/red = significant nuisance). Results not concerning the aforementioned modes of transport are represented with numbers alone (0–5).
haittojenHallintaForm.instructions2: Transport mode selectors on the left side of the map allow you to view the inconvenience indices for project and work areas regarding particular transport modes. All transport modes are active by default. You can change visibility of the modes by clicking on the icons. The most critical index will be coloured in on the map.
haittojenHallintaForm.noAlueet: Add project areas to fill in information
haittojenHallintaForm.instructionsPlan: Detail in the nuisance management plan which measures you will take to mitigate disturbances concerning the project areas. Be sure to go through all project areas.
haittojenHallintaForm.instructionsGeneral: <0><0>Ensure the safety and accessibility of pedestrian traffic</0><1>Ensure transport connections to the properties</1><2>Carry out coordination with other projects and their alternate routes</2><3>Always notify the Rescue Department and the police when streets are closed from traffic</3><4>Always check whether your project or work is on a special transport route</4><5>Check the impacts on the existing traffic light controls (lane arrangements, indicators, the functionality of the lights)</5><6>Exceptional working hours</6></0>
haittojenHallintaForm.helperText: Nuisance management or prevention measures that are to be carried out or have been agreed upon in the project area.
haittojenHallintaForm.subHeaderTrafficNuisanceIndex: Based on the traffic nuisance index calculated for your project, special attention must be paid to the following requirements.
haittojenHallintaForm.noNuisanceDetected: Haitaton was unable to find that target group in the area. Add measures for managing the inconvenience, if necessary.
haittojenHallintaForm.addControlPlan: Add measures for managing the inconvenience

carTrafficNuisanceType.kaistapituushaitta: Length of vehicle traffic lane impact

PYORALIIKENNE.tip: Check the impacts on primary and priority cycling routes and ensure their availability. Make sure that quality level targets are met for temporary arrangements.

Prepare to carry out work outside of rush hour on the primary and priority cycling routes, if such an order is issued in the decision regarding your notification/application. Restrictions will be put in place on weekdays at 6–9 am and 3–6 pm.

Priority of cycling measures: 1. No changes to cycling arrangements / route excluded from the worksite; 2. Temporary shift of cycling route; 3. Temporary narrowing of cycling route; 4. Merging of transport modes on one lane (see Separation of transport modes); 5. Temporary move of cycling route to opposite side of vehicle lane; 6. Temporary alternate cycling route

As a rule, plan and implement temporary cycling arrangement in accordance with the original, permanent arrangements (e.g. one-way cycle paths/lanes or two-way cycling path). Try to retain cycling solutions that are separated from pedestrians, if currently in use. When vehicle traffic exceeds 7,000 cars per day, cycling should generally be separated from vehicle lanes as well. On primary cycling routes, separation should be a consideration even with smaller vehicle traffic volumes. Single direction cycling arrangements may only be proposed to be replaced with a mixed traffic solution at worksites, in which case a 30 km/h speed limit is set on the street.

Plan and implement temporary crossing solutions for cycling routes, particularly at traffic light-controlled intersections, traffic direction function in mind, paying special attention to left turns, vision and lighting.
Plan and implement clear signpost guidance for detours with specific consideration for cycling routes. Define the impacts on cycling and other necessary measures for the detour.
Plan and implement cycling access to the different addresses, services etc.

Find out the need to move a possible city bike station or other significant bicycle parking. Agree on city bike station changes with Kaupunkiliikenne Oy (<0>urakoitsijaohjeistus@kaupunkiliikenne.fi</0>) and with the Urban Environment Division’s traffic planning unit on significant changes to bicycle parking (<1>kaupunkiymparisto@hel.fi</1>, customer service tel. +358 9 310 22111).

Announce significant works and possible cycling route changes as early as in the planning stage, well in advance of implementing new arrangements (general releases, local releases). Mark detours before the works begin.
Firstly, implement cycling protections from the work area with railings and closures.
Implement winter maintenance for cycling routes (incl. snow removal, anti-slip measures) next to the work area.
Implement and maintain hard and clean cycling route surfaces (temporary pavement) as well as implement level changes with ramps.
Notify different parties of the works and possible route changes well in advance of implementing the new arrangements (general releases, local releases).
Verify that your planned solutions comply with the instructions (in Finnish): <0>https://www.hel.fi/static/hkr/luvat/pyoraliikenteen_tyomaaohje.pdf</0>

AUTOLIIKENNE.tip: Study the compound impact of traffic lane changes and timing with a traffic model. Also determine the changes to bus traffic. Study the requirements of the project and find out possible detour solutions.

Study the impact, timing, and measures your project has on traffic lanes with a traffic model and simulation. Define and plan the measures to minimise any inconveniences, keeping other projects in the area in mind.
Plan for your works to be primarily carried out outside of rush hour (weekdays at 6–9 am and 3–6 pm, and everyday on harbour routes at 10–10:30 am).
Study and implement guidance methods to reduce the traffic volume in the project’s area of impact.
Plan any vehicle detours, related guidance, and the necessary traffic light changes in advance.

Check if your project is on a harbour traffic route (<0>Parking and route maps</0>). If this is the case, plan your works outside of rush hour (weekdays at 6–9 am and 3–6 pm, as well as every at 10–10:30 am on harbour routes).
Plan the arrangements or alternate routes for heavy vehicle traffic as well as maintenance and distribution traffic well in advance.
Find out the number of required lanes from the Urban Environment Division’s traffic planning unit (<0>kaupunkiymparisto@hel.fi</0>, customer service tel. +358 9 310 22111) in the planning stage

Plan and ensure traffic light functioning in an area wider than the worksite (e.g. lane changes at traffic light-controlled intersections when entering the work area, indicator positioning and functioning during temporary arrangements, traffic lights on detours). To make these arrangements, contact the Helsinki Region Traffic Control Centre (<0>liikenteenhallintakeskus@hel.fi</0>, tel. +358 9 310 37555). Also contact them if you require temporary traffic lights.

Contact the Bus Federation (<0>Yhteystiedot – Linja-autoliitto</0> <1>firstname.lastname@linja-autoliitto.fi</1>), if your project takes place on a significant route or area for long-distance or tourist bus traffic.
Announce significant works and possible vehicle route changes as early as in the planning stage, well in advance of the implementation (general releases, local releases).
Implement and maintain advance guidance from approaches to alternate routes.
Lower speed limits in the vicinity of work areas.
Do not direct pedestrians to use the vehicle lanes, unless they are given a protected passage there.
Do not direct bicycle traffic to vehicle lanes, unless the situation allows for it (see Suggested measures for cycling).
Implement and maintain a consistent-quality pavement as well as up-to-date lane change and other markings and traffic control devices.
Implement high-quality winter maintenance in the work area (e.g. snow removal, anti-slip measures, clear visibility and driving space).

LINJAAUTOLIIKENNE.tip: Check if your project impacts a significant HSL bus route. Agree, early on, with HSL on the required measures of your project for bus traffic (<0>infra@hsl.fi</0>).
Plan the works and as a rule, carry them out outside of rush hour (6–9 am, 3–6 pm).

Contact HSL (<0>infra@hsl.fi</0>) in the planning stage if your project is on an HSL bus route and define, whether your project causes an inconvenience to HSL bus traffic, such as reduction in lanes, delays, longer travel time, route or stop changes etc. Plan possible bus detours in advance, along with related guidance and necessary mass transit benefits. Ensure that the route is functional for HSL and the Helsinki Region Traffic Control Centre (<1>liikenteenhallintakeskus@hel.fi</1>, tel. +358 9 310 37555; including for temporary traffic light control).

If a worksite is at a bus terminus or prevents bus traffic on a street, contact HSL at least 2.5 months before the works are set to begin. If your worksite is not urgent, such as one required by a burst pipe, contact them at least 2 weeks before the start of the work. Further information: <0>Contractor – how to consider public transport on worksites</0>.

Implement unimpeded access to existing stops or plan the move of the stops, related guidance, and accessible pedestrian routes. Tram or bus stops may not be moved or closed without permission from HSL (<0>infra@hsl.fi</0>). Further information: <1>Contractor – how to consider public transport on worksites</1>.
Announce significant works and possible bus route changes as early as in the planning stage, well in advance of the implementation (general releases, local releases).
Implement and maintain advance guidance from approaches to alternate routes.
Implement and maintain a consistent-quality pavement as well as up-to-date lane change and other markings and traffic control devices.

Implement high-quality winter maintenance in the work area (e.g. snow removal, anti-slip measures, clear visibility and driving space). Pay particular attention to bus turning circles in intersections.

RAITIOLIIKENNE.tip: Check if your project impacts the tram network. Early on, agree with HSL (services: <0>infra@hsl.fi</0>) on measures of your project for the tram network and, if necessary, with Kaupunkiliikenne Oy (rail infrastructure and systems: <1>urakoitsijaohjeistus@kaupunkiliikenne.fi</1>).
Plan for the works to be carried out primarily outside of rail traffic service hours or rush hour (6–9 am, 3–6 pm).

Evaluate the schedule of individual works in your project in advance and contact HSL (traffic services: <0>infra@hsl.fi</0>) and Kaupunkiliikenne Oy (rail infrastructure and systems: <1>urakoitsijaohjeistus@kaupunkiliikenne.fi</1>) to coordinate possible alternate arrangements with other alternate routes. Plan possible rail detours and mass transit benefits in advance and ensure the functioning of the route with HSL, Kaupunkiliikenne Oy and in terms of traffic lights, with the Helsinki Region Traffic Control Centre (<2>liikenteenhallintakeskus@hel.fi</2>, tel. +358 9 310 37555).

With rail traffic detours, notify HSL at least 8 weeks in advance of a work that lasts up to 3 days, and 5 months in advance of a work that lasts over 3 days. If rail traffic is replaced by buses, notify HSL at least 3 months in advance of a work that lasts up to 3 days, and 5 months in advance of a work that lasts over 3 days. Further information: <0>Constructor – considering mass transit at worksites</0> and <1>Works in the vicinity of tram tracks – Kaupunkiliikenne Oy</1>

Check if tram track structures (incl. trolley wire attachments on buildings) or systems have to be temporarily disabled or moved. Also check if work areas are close to track areas or within 2 metres of trolley wires or carrier cables (NOTE! This distance is 4 metres on the fast light rail line). If this is necessary, agree on the arrangements with HSL (traffic services: <0>infra@hsl.fi</0>) and Kaupunkiliikenne Oy (track infrastructure and systems: <1>urakoitsijaohjeistus@kaupunkiliikenne.fi</1>. Further information: <2>Contractor – how to consider public transport on worksites</2> and a submittable form, <3>Works close to a tram track – Kaupunkiliikenne Oy</3> (Works close to tram tracks or near light rail line 15’s track area).

Implement unimpeded access to existing stops or plan the move of the stops, related guidance, and accessible pedestrian routes. Tram or bus stops may not be moved or closed without permission from HSL (<0>infra@hsl.fi</0>). Further information: <1>Contractor – how to consider public transport on worksites</1>.
Announce significant works and possible rail route changes as early as in the planning stage, well in advance of the implementation (general releases, local releases).
In your guidance, make sure that the trams’ traffic light controls function during the works.

MUUT.tip: Study the area impacted by noise, dust or vibration from your project and the sensitive functions therein (apartments, schools, vital services such as health, business premises, restaurant terraces, research institutes, nature targets, religious facilities etc.).

Inform the operators and properties at least one week before or immediately upon becoming aware of the start date of the work, when carrying out works that cause noise, dust or vibrations. Advance notifications are required for significantly disruptive works, at least 30 days before the work starts. Give the residents and various operators sufficient time to prepare for the upcoming disruption and negotiate with the operators of particularly sensitive functions.
Study the opportunities or scheduling and work methods of your project to minimise emissions for these functions.
Prepare a notification of disruptive noise at least 30 days before the works begin: <0>Notification of noise</0>
Significantly noisy operations are generally not allowed in the vicinity of residential buildings, accommodation or care facilities at night (10 pm – 7 am).
Noisy work should be avoided close to daycare centres at 12–2 pm, close to schools during 8 am – 3 pm, and close to office buildings during 9 am – 3 pm.
Implement measures that reduce the noise disturbance, such as movable noise barriers.

Prepare a collection plan for worksite water as part of the site plan in advance (start with evaluating the volume and quality of the water that needs to be collected). Any release of worksite water into the stormwater network must be agreed with Helsinki Region Environmental Services (HSY, <0>https://yhteydenotto.hsy.fi/asiakaspalvelu</0>, tel. +358 9 1561 2110). Initially, confirm with HSY on the network effect of releasing worksite water to the stormwater network on nature values (e.g. uncontrolled release of facade renovation dust into the network). Additional information: <1>Sewage instructions for worksite water</1> and <2>https://www.hel.fi/static/ymk/esitteet/tyomaavesi.pdf</2>

Wash the nearby streets daily, if the worksite features significant amounts of gravel or loose dirt. Prevent dusting from traffic lanes with a saline solution or by using a crushed stone surface. Also wash the worksite vehicles regularly.
Wet and cover stored soil and stone material as well as construction waste. Wet and cover dusty loads during transportation outside of construction sites.
Use dust collection equipment on open pit excavation devices (under 200 metres away from sensitive locations or when the quarry transportation route passes near dust-sensitive locations).
Verify that your solutions are compliant with the instructions: <0>https://www.hel.fi/static/ymk/esitteet/rakennustyomaapoly.pdf</0>
Prepare a notification of disruptive (noise and) vibration at least 30 days before the works begin: <0>Notification of noise</0>
Check the soil data and how much it conducts vibration. Plan to use work methods that minimise vibration.

hankkeenLiitteetForm.instructions: Add attachments. Attachments added to the project will not be transferred to the applications.

hankkeenYhteenvetoForm.instructions: Please check the information you entered and save the project or save and move to add applications.

finishedForm.header: The form has been successfully submitted

perustiedot.instructions:
Please note that the cable report will be valid for a month. The cable report must be valid when ordering cabling terrain surveys and submitting excavation notifications. If necessary, the cable report must be updated.

For work to be done in public areas, a separate notification must be submitted to the City. See the more detailed instructions: hel.fi

alueet.instructions1: Start drawing the report area by adding the start and end dates of the work. The drawing tools will appear in the bottom left corner of the map. You can now draw the report areas on the map. You can add multiple areas to the same application if they are covered by the same timespan.
alueet.instructions2: The areas you draw are shown as a list under the map. You can also remove areas from the list.
alueet.instructions3: You can edit an already drawn area by grabbing its edge and dragging the point to the desired location.
alueet.giveDates: Select the work dates to draw the work areas on the map.

yhteystiedot.instructions: Please add the details and contact persons of participating parties. The person submitting the application must be at least one party's contact person. The participating parties included on the application will be sent an email invitation to the project and granted viewing rights. You can edit the participating parties’ access rights and details later in the project’s user management.

liitteet.instructions: Add attachments to the application, such as a work plan.

kaivuilmoitusForm.requiredInstruction: Filling out all fields marked with the asterisk * is required for submitting the application.

perustiedot.instructions:
Any excavation, drilling or quarrying works carried out on streets, on pedestrian or cycling routes, on market squares or in parks in Helsinki require submitting an excavation notification. When an excavation notification is submitted, the authority is also automatically requested for a cable report if the identifier of a previously issued cable report is not attached to the application.

An essential part of the application is a nuisance management plan filled out by the user, the implementation of which will be monitored by the authority during the work. A temporary traffic arrangement plan is created as an attachment to the notification if the work affects pedestrian, cycling or motor vehicle traffic, or parking spaces are reserved for other use with a moving request sign.

The excavation work must be reported as operational in the winter season (1 December–14 May) and complete in all cases so that the work can be supervised and invoicing can be suspended or ended.

$t(kaivuilmoitusForm:requiredInstruction) The name of the work is required for saving the form.
perustiedot.cableReportInstructions: You can either apply for a new cable report or select cable reports already added to the project.

alueet.instructions:
Start drawing the work areas of the application by entering start and end dates for the work, whereby your project areas will be displayed. PLEASE NOTE! The work must be scheduled within the timespan for the project area.

You can edit a previously drawn area by grabbing its edge and dragging the point to the desired location.

If you want to draw smaller work areas within the project areas, activate the drawing tools on top of the map. Please note that the work areas must be drawn entirely within the project areas.

If you want to use the entire project area as a work area, activate the project area on the map and select ‘Use as work area’.

You can add several areas to the same application if they have the same timespan. If you want to enter several areas with different timespans, you must submit a separate application.

[TRANSLATION_PENDING]

$t(kaivuilmoitusForm:requiredInstruction)
alueet.liikennehaittaindeksienYhteenveto: Summary of traffic inconvenience indices for worksites

liitteetJaLisatiedot.instructions:
Add plans for temporary traffic arrangements and any other attachments. A plan for temporary traffic arrangements is obligatory. If necessary, see the City of Helsinki’s standard solution images.

If filling out the form or carrying out the work have not been authorised in the login process, a PDF-format power of attorney must be provided as an attachment.

All fields marked with the asterisk * are necessary for submitting the application.
liitteetJaLisatiedot.mandateInfo: For data protection reasons, a power of attorney added to the application cannot be viewed after saving. Please verify that you have the correct power of attorney before attaching it to the application.

yhteenveto.instructions: Check the information you entered and submit the notification for processing.

haittojenHallinta.instructions: Your work may hinder different transport modes and local operations. Haitaton automatically calculates the significance of the nuisance for each project and work area separately for cycling, rail, local bus services, and car traffic. The traffic nuisance index describes the worst situation in the project area for these transport modes.
haittojenHallinta.instructions2: Nuisances are described on a scale defined for each transport mode, using numbers and colours (0/grey = not identified, 1–2/green = no significant nuisance, 3/yellow = likely nuisance, 4–5/red = significant nuisance). The results for transport modes other than those mentioned above are shown in numerical form only (0–5).
haittojenHallinta.instructions4: In your nuisance control plan, specify the measures you will take to control nuisances in your work areas. The nuisance control measures specified for the project areas will form the basis of the plan for the work areas. Please remember to go through all the work areas.
haittojenHallinta.helperText: Actions to be taken or agreed measures in work areas to control or prevent nuisances

sendDialog.title: Submit application?
sendDialog.instructions: The decision concerning your application and possible requests for additional information will be available in the Haitaton system. By submitting your application, you consent to being notified electronically.
sendDialog.instructionsPaperDecision: You may also request a paper copy of the decision to an address you specify.
sendDialog.orderPaperDecision: I want a printed copy of the decision
sendDialog.paperDecisionNotificationText: To receive a paper copy of the decision, please provide the recipient information here.
sendDialog.name: Name

sentDialog.title: Application sent
sentDialog.description: The application has been sent and can no longer be edited. You can view the information of the application on the application page.

areaSelectionDialog.title: Choose a project area for the work area
areaSelectionDialog.instructions: The work area is located within several project areas. Choose the project area into which the work area will be added.
areaSelectionDialog.cancelButton: Cancel and remove the work area

operationalConditionDialog.title: Report functional condition?
operationalConditionDialog.instructions:
If an excavation site is available for normal use during the winter season (1 January – 14 May), you can report it as being in functional condition, which suspends the usage fee of the area.


Traffic lanes, bicycle paths and the pavement must have a temporary asphalt surface. All traffic control devices must be removed from the site. Stone ash or finely crushed quarry may be used on pedestrian and other areas, if this has been agreed in advance with an inspector.


If the area is not paved temporarily, and a notification of functional condition has not been submitted, fees will continue to be charged until compliance has been restored.
The area’s surfaces must be paved in accordance with the street classification by 14 May, or the usage fees will resume on 15 May until the work is accepted as completed.


Enter the date on which you intend to report the work to be in functional condition. {{previousReportsIntro}}
operationalConditionDialog.previousReportsIntro: Previously, the work was reported to be in functional condition as follows:

workFinishedDialog.title: Report completion?
workFinishedDialog.instructions: Enter the date on which you are reporting the work the be completed. {{previousReportsIntro}}

hankeIndexes.haittaindexTooltip: Nuisance indices are calculated by project area. The indices are updated when you save the form or go to the next page.
hankeIndexes.indexesNotCalculated: No nuisance indices have been calculated.

tooltips.PYORALIIKENNE:
• 0: No identified cycling route
  • 1: Park route with potential bicycle traffic
  • 2: Other bicycle traffic connections
  • 3: Other cycling routes (or the route/connection classification is missing from the bicycle traffic background data)
  • 5: A main cycling route or a street that is part of a main route
tooltips.AUTOLIIKENNE: A weighted nuisance index (0–5) is calculated for car traffic according to the areas it includes.
tooltips.autoKatuluokka:
• 0: No identified street classification
  • 1: Residential street, service road or low-traffic street
  • 2: A city centre residential street, service road or low-traffic street
  • 3: Local collector street
  • 4: Regional collector street
  • 5: Main street or motorway
tooltips.autoliikenneMaara:
• 0: No identified car traffic
  • 1: Less than 500 cars during a weekday
  • 2: 500–1,499 cars during a weekday
  • 3: 1 500–4,999 cars during a weekday
  • 4: 5 000–9,999 cars during a weekday
  • 5: 10,000 or more cars during a weekday
tooltips.autoKaistaHaitta:
• 0: No impact on the number of car traffic lanes
  • 1: $t(hanke:kaistaHaitta:YKSI_KAISTA_VAHENEE)
  • 2: $t(hanke:kaistaHaitta:YKSI_KAISTA_VAHENEE_KAHDELLA_AJOSUUNNALLA)
  • 3: $t(hanke:kaistaHaitta:USEITA_KAISTOJA_VAHENEE_AJOSUUNNILLA)
  • 4: $t(hanke:kaistaHaitta:YKSI_AJOSUUNTA_POISTUU_KAYTOSTA)
  • 5: $t(hanke:kaistaHaitta:USEITA_AJOSUUNTIA_POISTUU_KAYTOSTA)
tooltips.autoKaistaPituusHaitta:
• 1: Will not affect traffic lane arrangements
  • 2: Length of vehicle traffic lane impact is less than 10 m
  • 3: Length of vehicle traffic lane impact is less than 10–99 m
  • 4: Length of vehicle traffic lane impact is less than 100–499 m
  • 5: Length of vehicle traffic lane impact is 500 m or more
  • 5:
tooltips.autoHankkeenKesto:
• 1: Project duration: less than 2 weeks
  • 3: Project duration: 2 weeks to 3 months
  • 5: Project duration: more than 3 months
  • 5:
tooltips.autoTyonKesto:
• 1: Work duration: less than 2 weeks
  • 3: Work duration: 2 weeks to 3 months
  • 5: Work duration: more than 3 months
  • 5:
tooltips.LINJAAUTOLIIKENNE:
• 0: No local bus traffic
  • 2: Local bus traffic at off-peak times
  • 3: Number of local bus routes do not exceed 10 buses per peak hour
  • 4: Number of local bus routes do not exceed 20 buses per peak hour
  • 5: Kamppi-Rautatientori area, Mannerheimintie, Kaisaniemenkatu, Hämeentie or local bus routes with more than 20 buses per peak hour
tooltips.RAITIOLIIKENNE:
• 0: No identified tram rails
  • 3: Section of the tram network without regular service
  • 5: Section of the tram network with regular service
  • 5:

homepage.pageSubTitle_loggedIn: The system is intended for advancing projects taking place in public areas and managing the disturbances caused by them
homepage.pageSubTitle: Service for monitoring projects and their negative impacts in public areas
homepage.info: In the Haitaton service, you can learn about and give feedback on all ongoing and upcoming projects in public areas. You can view projects on a map or in a list. Are you starting a project or submitting applications?

notification.heading: Help us improve Haitaton!
notification.text: You can send ideas and feedback to the address

hanke.title: Create a new project
hanke.description: By creating a Haitaton project, you can plan work in the public domain in advance and make applications such as cabling surveys.

hakemus.title: Application/Working phase
hakemus.description: The applications are for excavation or land lease notices or temporary traffic arrangements.

johtotietoselvitys.title: Cable report
johtotietoselvitys.description: A request for clarification on cable location information for a specific area. Required as an attachment to the excavation notice.

valmistelu.title: Project in the preparatory phase
valmistelu.description: A project for long-term review and planning that does not consist of applications.

hankesalkku.title: Own projects
hankesalkku.description: In your own projects, you will find the projects and applications that you have previously created.

hankelista.title: Project list
hankelista.description: View a list of ongoing and upcoming projects.

kartta.title: View the projects
kartta.description: View a map or a list of ongoing and upcoming projects in public areas.

kartta_kirjautumaton.title: Projects on a map
kartta_kirjautumaton.description: View current and future projects on a map

tietoja_haitattomasta.title: About Haitaton
tietoja_haitattomasta.description: Here, you can find more detailed information on the notification process as well as on the different functionalities of Haitaton.

ohjeet.title: Work instructions
ohjeet.description: See the guidelines for projects in public areas.

loginContainer.description: Before starting work in the City of Helsinki that involves digging, excavation or drilling, a valid cable report must be requested.
loginContainer.button: Log in to submit an application
loginContainer.imageAltText: Kalasatama Metro Station and a worksite. The station is seen as a separate glass-walled oval structure above the worksite. In the front, the earth has been dug open, and to the left, buildings of the upcoming shopping centre rise up. The worksite continues behind the metro station up to the Kuorekari straits. To the right, parts of the Suvilahti Power Plant can be seen.

accessRightsInfo.heading: What can be done with the different rights?
accessRightsInfo.KAIKKI_OIKEUDET: All rights enables you to edit a project and its application content, edit everyone’s access rights and remove a project if it has no applications that have received a decision.
accessRightsInfo.KAIKKIEN_MUOKKAUS: The project and application editing right enables you to create and edit a project and the content of its applications and edit others’ access rights, except ‘all rights’, which enables removing a project.
accessRightsInfo.HANKEMUOKKAUS: The project editing right enables you to edit the information of a project but not access rights. This right enables you to view the application information.
accessRightsInfo.HAKEMUSASIOINTI: The application services right enables you to create new applications for a project and edit the information of the applications of the project.
accessRightsInfo.KATSELUOIKEUS: The viewing right enables you to view a project and its information. The viewing right is automatically granted to all persons added to the project and its applications.
accessRightsInfo.modifyInfo: You can change access rights by making a selection in the dropdown menu and clicking the ‘Save’ button. You can also send someone a new invitation link to Haitaton if they have not received it before.

content.onlyOmistajanYhteyshenkilo: The user is the project owner's only contact person and therefore cannot be deleted. First add another contact person for the project owner and then return to delete the user of your choice.
content.activeHakemuksetPending: The user cannot be deleted because they have been added to the following applications: {{applications}}. You can cancel the application and create a new one.
content.activeHakemuksetHandling: The user cannot be deleted because they have been added to the following applications: {{applications}}. Delete the user from the application by making a notification about a change to the application, replacing the user with another. After that, you can delete the user via user management.
content.draftHakemukset: The user has been added to applications in a draft state: {{applications}}. Deleting the user will delete their information from the application as well. If necessary, check that all the mandatory contact details for the application have been entered. Are you sure you want to delete the user?
content.confirmText: The user's contact information will be deleted for all project roles. Are you sure you want to delete the user?

tooltips.areaDates: The timespan you enter will affect the map view. Only projects and works taking place within the determined timespan will be shown on the map. By default, you will see this project and its related work areas. You can use the level menu of the map to display other areas.
